title: Orchid & Houseplants Pest Control Made Easy  DIY Garlic-Infused Alcohol Solution #ninjaorchids

tasks.task: Prepare and apply a fungicide and insecticide solution to orchids to control moth larvae.
subtasks: Gather and process garlic cloves into a solution.
Dilute isopropyl alcohol with water to the appropriate concentration.
Combine garlic and alcohol solution in a sealed container.
Allow the garlic solution to infuse for at least 24 hours.
Mix ground garlic with distilled water for a separate fungicide solution.
Allow the fungicide solution to infuse for 24 hours.
Apply the insecticide solution to the undersides of orchid leaves.
Apply the fungicide solution to affected areas of the orchids.

tasks.task: Create and maintain a log of the experiment's effectiveness.
subtasks: Document the application process and dates.
Monitor the orchids for pest activity.
Evaluate the effectiveness of the homemade solutions.
Update viewers based on the results of the experiment.
